body:
<!-- This form is for bug reports and feature requests ONLY!

If you're looking for help check [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/kubernetes) and the [troubleshooting guide](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/debug-application-cluster/troubleshooting/).

If this may be security issue, please disclose it privately via https://kubernetes.io/security/.
-->

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

> Uncomment only one, leave it on its own line:
>
/kind bug
> /kind feature


**What happened**: When attempting to set up a Python-Flask backed APIService; upon adding an `/openapi/v2` route, the kube-apiserver process panicked and the container failed repeatedly until I was able to stop the new extension's pod manually.
```
I0423 18:55:11.071026       1 controller.go:105] OpenAPI AggregationController: Processing item v1.flask.k8s.io
E0423 18:55:13.110177       1 runtime.go:66] Observed a panic: "assignment to entry in nil map" (assignment to entry in nil map)
/workspace/anago-v1.10.1-beta.0.68+d4ab47518836c7/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/apimachinery/pkg/util/runtime/runtime.go:72

/usr/local/go/src/runtime/hashmap.go:523

/workspace/anago-v1.10.1-beta.0.68+d4ab47518836c7/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/kube-aggregator/pkg/controllers/openapi/aggregator.go:210

/workspace/anago-v1.10.1-beta.0.68+d4ab47518836c7/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/kube-aggregator/pkg/controllers/openapi/controller.go:87
/workspace/anago-v1.10.1-beta.0.68+d4ab47518836c7/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/apimachinery/pkg/util/wait/wait.go:133
/workspace/anago-v1.10.1-beta.0.68+d4ab47518836c7/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/apimachinery/pkg/util/wait/wait.go:134

k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/kube-openapi/pkg/aggregator.MergeSpecsIgnorePathConflict(0xc43166e500, 0xc42a7ecf00, 0x0, 0x0)
	/workspace/anago-v1.10.1-beta.0.68+d4ab47518836c7/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/kube-openapi/pkg/aggregator/aggregator.go:230 +0x3c
k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/kube-aggregator/pkg/controllers/openapi.(*specAggregator).buildOpenAPISpec(0xc42a834ba0, 0x3, 0x0, 0x0)
	/workspace/anago-v1.10.1-beta.0.68+d4ab47518836c7/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/kube-aggregator/pkg/controllers/openapi/aggregator.go:210 +0x2fc
k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/kube-aggregator/pkg/controllers/openapi.(*specAggregator).updateOpenAPISpec(0xc42a834ba0, 0xc42a834bd0, 0xc42949b2f0)
	/workspace/anago-v1.10.1-beta.0.68+d4ab47518836c7/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/kube-aggregator/pkg/controllers/openapi/aggregator.go:226 +0xbd
k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/kube-aggregator/pkg/controllers/openapi.(*specAggregator).tryUpdatingServiceSpecs(0xc42a834ba0, 0xc42f4e71e0, 0x1, 0x1)
	/workspace/anago-v1.10.1-beta.0.68+d4ab47518836c7/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/kube-aggregator/pkg/controllers/openapi/aggregator.go:245 +0xcc
k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/kube-aggregator/pkg/controllers/openapi.(*specAggregator).UpdateAPIServiceSpec(0xc42a834ba0, 0xc429e356a0, 0xf, 0xc43166e300, 0xc429514f20, 0xa3, 0x0, 0x0)
	/workspace/anago-v1.10.1-beta.0.68+d4ab47518836c7/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/kube-aggregator/pkg/controllers/openapi/aggregator.go:287 +0x1c7
k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/kube-aggregator/pkg/controllers/openapi.(*AggregationController).sync(0xc42289aab0, 0xc429e356a0, 0xf, 0xc421e39de0, 0x1, 0x1)
	/workspace/anago-v1.10.1-beta.0.68+d4ab47518836c7/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/kube-aggregator/pkg/controllers/openapi/controller.go:141 +0x1d7
k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/kube-aggregator/pkg/controllers/openapi.(*AggregationController).(k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/kube-aggregator/pkg/controllers/openapi.sync)-fm(0xc429e356a0, 0xf, 0xc421e39de0, 0x1, 0x1)
	/workspace/anago-v1.10.1-beta.0.68+d4ab47518836c7/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/kube-aggregator/pkg/controllers/openapi/controller.go:74 +0x3e

	/workspace/anago-v1.10.1-beta.0.68+d4ab47518836c7/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/apimachinery/pkg/util/wait/wait.go:88 +0x4d
created by k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/kube-aggregator/pkg/controllers/openapi.(*AggregationController).Run
	/workspace/anago-v1.10.1-beta.0.68+d4ab47518836c7/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/kube-aggregator/pkg/controllers/openapi/controller.go:87 +0x179
```

**What you expected to happen**: When processing the OpenAPI specification, kube-apiserver either completes the process successfully, or fails to process the response and otherwise continues to operate normally.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
Have an APIService respond to requests for `/openapi/v2` with the following JSON:
```
{
   "swagger": "2.0",
   "info": {
    "title": "Flask Test API", 
    "version": "1.0.0"
  }, 
  "paths": {
    "/apis/flask.example.com/v1": {
      "get": {
        "description": "", 
        "responses": {
          "200": {
            "description": "OK"
          }
        }, 
        "summary": "Get the api resources.", 
        "tags": [
          "test"
        ]
      }
    }, 
    "/apis/flask.example.com/v1/exampleResources": {
      "get": {
        "description": "", 
        "responses": {
          "200": {
            "description": "OK"
          }
        }, 
        "summary": "Get list of IPs.", 
        "tags": [
          "test"
        ]
      }
    }
  }
}

```

**Anything else we need to know?**: N/A

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): 
```
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"10", GitVersion:"v1.10.0", GitCommit:"fc32d2f3698e36b93322a3465f63a14e9f0eaead", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2018-03-26T16:55:54Z", GoVersion:"go1.9.3", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"10", GitVersion:"v1.10.1", GitCommit:"d4ab47518836c750f9949b9e0d387f20fb92260b", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2018-04-12T14:14:26Z", GoVersion:"go1.9.3", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration: 3 metal nodes
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release):
```
NAME="Ubuntu"
VERSION="16.04.4 LTS (Xenial Xerus)"
ID=ubuntu
ID_LIKE=debian
PRETTY_NAME="Ubuntu 16.04.4 LTS"
VERSION_ID="16.04"
HOME_URL="http://www.ubuntu.com/"
SUPPORT_URL="http://help.ubuntu.com/"
BUG_REPORT_URL="http://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/"
VERSION_CODENAME=xenial
UBUNTU_CODENAME=xenial
```
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
```
Linux Kubernetes1 4.4.0-119-generic #143-Ubuntu SMP Mon Apr 2 16:08:24 UTC 2018 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```
- Install tools: Kubeadm 1.10
- Others: N/A

labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG API Machinery.
labels.name: sig/api-machinery

title: kube-apiserver container panics if I add a /openapi/v2 route to my APIService
